body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur. 
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=2db3b616f01a0d64fdcc6c124ac677d5

```rust
use std::path::PathBuf;

fn main() {
    fn is_file(p: &PathBuf) -> bool {
        p.is_dir()
    }
    
    let f: Option<PathBuf> = Some(PathBuf::from("/"));
    
    let f_if_file = f.as_ref().filter(is_file);

    println!("{:?}", f_if_file);
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0631]: type mismatch in function arguments
  --> src/main.rs:10:39
   |
4  |     fn is_file(p: &PathBuf) -> bool {
   |     ------------------------------- found signature of `for<'r> fn(&'r PathBuf) -> _`
...
10 |     let f_if_file = f.as_ref().filter(is_file);
   |                                       ^^^^^^^ expected signature of `for<'r> fn(&'r &PathBuf) -> _`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0631`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

The error message is confusing, and also doesn't point at the correct solution in this case, which is removing the `.as_ref()`.

There are other issues open related to `E0631`, but I wasn't able to figure out if this is already covered, so I opened this to make sure it's known. Sorry if it's a duplicate!
